data.title: Iconic Bar in FW
data.text:
Just a must if you are in Fort Worth!

Very Iconic bar, now in their new building, much more space and a wonderful outdoor seating area, perfect.

data.title: Craft Beer Paradise
data.text:
Craft Small Production beer , A wall of more than 300 taps of all genres of Lager , IPA , Double IPA , Stout and Ales
The ambience matches the beer theme and they waitresses wear uniform that says 'Beer Godess" , there was a huge outside area with life music. Food seems to be good but didn't try it as we wanted to keep the space for the delicious beer.

data.title: Great outdoor area
data.text: I like the Flying Saucer chain, it provides a variety of beers, drinks and selection of food to accommodate everyone.  Their outdoor patio and live music add to the charm of this specific location.

data.title: A great selection of outstanding draft beers!
data.text: There are probably about 150 beers on tap, then others in bottles, in this fun pub. The food on the menu was also quite good.

data.title: Fun Place
data.text:
I went with a group of friends in town for a convention.  We sat outside.  I am not a beer drinker (never trusted anything that went in and came out the same color) but those who were in the group seemed enamored with the selection.  And when one could not make up his or her mind or had questions about beers with which they were unfamiliar the waitress would bring small samples to assist in the choice.

The setting is nice.  We sat outside under live oak trees on picnic tables.  It is walking distance to major hotels.  The waitress was attentive, but not hovering. And there is a mermiad embedded on the floor of the bathroom.  What more could you ask for?

data.title: Lots of beer
data.text: We didn't order food on our visit, just drinks. We were fortunate that the weather was nice, and we sat outdoors. They have a huge beer list, both draft and bottles. Service was friendly but a tad slow. The atmosphere was nice with a band on stage, just the right volume.

data.title: Great lunch today, loved the salad
data.text: The Harvest Salad was absolutely awesome!  The Turkey sandwich with jalapeño mayo and avocado was also delish.  We would totally go back.

data.title: Solid offering on the beer front
data.text: Went in on a weeknight, it seems not to have changed at all in the last 20 years and I say that as a positive.  Nice biergarten, there was some kind of interpretive poetry reading shenanigans going on out there.  I sat at the bar.  Bartenders were friendly in spite of being fairly hip type youngsters.  Beer selection stands up well, both on the draft and bottled beer fronts.  Inside there was some kind of bar trivia game happening, seemed to be drawing some interest from the inside crowd.

data.title: Great beer, slow service
data.text: Have been here a couple of times, beer and food delicious; the only down side was the slow service (I went on a weeknight and we still weren't properly waited on). Also the fact that they always charge cover for the band playing, even if you want to sit inside and not watch the band.

data.title: Best bar in Forth Worth
data.text:
This was the best bar we frequented during our time in FW.

The band had started when we arrived and we had to pay a $5 cover charge to enter. This turned out to be money well spent as the band were excellent.

The bar has a huge selection of beers but strangely enough they didn't have the first few we chose off the menu.

Nevertheless we had plenty to choose from and were not disappointed with the choices.

We were seated outside and the service was fast and efficient . Went back a few times even when there wasn't a band on.

data.title: Average beer, poor service
data.text: Busy Saturday night; the beer was average, and the service was extremely slow. It was apparently our waitress's first night on the job, but she was flying solo and struggling. It would have been helpful to have someone shadow her and make sure she knew what she was doing. She wasn't knowledgable on the menu and a couple of us received the wrong order. There was a terrible band playing outside, and the bar tried to charge a cover, but we were able to talk the bouncer out of it. Other than that positive note, this was a very atypical experience for what is usually a sure thing.

data.title: Great biergarten!
data.text: Great atmosphere and service. One of the best biergartens we've visited since our trip to Bavaria and Austria. Our server was very knowledgeable about Texas beers. The only downside was that they were out of the Rahr beer that I ordered first. Nbd. There were many, many others to choose from.

data.title: 600 beers!
data.text: My Fort Worth friend took me there just after getting off my transatlantic flight. And what a selection! If we'd had some more time we might have been able try all 600 different types of beer. If you accomplish that they'll put up a plate with your name. Great! You'll not be dehydrating there! So enjoy the ambience and the beers.

data.title: Fun atmosphere- great Beer selection
data.text: The beer and fun are plentiful, the food is just so-so.  The activities, movies, free music all are part of the fun of the appeal.

data.title: Pricey but Pretty
data.text:
Went to the Flying Saucer to watch a band I'm close with. The drink selection- I was unimpressed with. If you like craft artisan beers with stout tastes, you may like the beer offered. However, they carry no draft, all imports, I personally did not care for at all. Even their light blonde beer left an icky taste behind. Ordered a margarita to switch it up, which tasted like straight sweet and sour mix. A lady next to me overheard me say that and said she agreed. Not very good drinks for such an expensive tab.The waitresses also seemed very uninterested, and it was as if you couldn't finish your sentence before they darted off. I understand busy nights, but customer service is KEY. The terrace by the stage is very nice and lit up but expect to get there extremely early to have a table to sit at. 
Overall the night was good.
The bartenders were very nice and attentive.I liked the atmosphere of the place, but I wouldn't recommend frequently visiting to have drinks and dinner for the price ..in my opinion. The music would be the only reason I would return, which the sound was lovely. Also parking is a disaster!!! Downtown Fort Worth, to be expected I guess. Just my two sense. 

Cheers and safe travels

-My Real Life

data.title: Great bar
data.text: The atmosphere of this bar is plain cool, and what else do you want to know.  The drinks are good and cool and there you have it.

data.title: Saucy Night
data.text:
Had planned to enjoy a long overdue date night. We decided to venture here to try something new and were left disappointed and bewildered. 

We ordered the cheese fries as an appetizer. We asked them to hold the Jalepenos and chives. Well, they had them hidden underneath when it was served. 

We ordered the saucy burger without onions, lettuce and tomato. When it came to the table, the burger had onions, lettuce and a tomato slice. 

We also ordered the German plate and asked to hold the sauerkraut. It was delivered with it smothered all over the brats, which tasted like spam. 

Both of us ordered salads and asked for them to hold the onions, olives, and tomatoes. Guess what, it was served will the three things we asked for them to omit. 

We sat there for an hour and half. Our water and tea glasses were never refilled. Had to go to Starbucks to get something to drink because we were so thirsty. 

When we shared with the waitress the errors, we were given a blank stare. 

Our saucer has flown to never land there again.

data.title: Always Good Beer
data.text: We stop here about once a week for a cool beverage.  Always something new on the menu and a breeze on the patio.  For dinner, start off splitting the fried zucchini.... Great way to start the meal.

data.title: Good food, awesome location, and even better beer selection
data.text: They have awesome food at a very reasonable price. Their beer selection is phenomenal, both their draft and bottle menu is very extensive. The service was very good when we went. Its in an awesome location right in the middle of Sundance square, its a great place for people watching.

data.title: Amazing
data.text: We were starving so naturally ordered an appie. We had these mouth watering tatter tot things, a must order.
